questions.question: Choose the correct form to complete the sentence: 'If it _____ tomorrow, we will stay home.'
Which sentence correctly uses the first conditional?
options: If she will call me, I answer.
If she calls me, I will answer.
If she called me, I would answer.
If she calling me, I will answer.
questions.answer: If she calls me, I will answer.

questions.question: Choose the correct option: 'If they _____ late, they will miss the train.'
Which sentence is a first conditional sentence?
options: If you study hard, you will pass the exam.
If you studied hard, you would pass the exam.
If you had studied hard, you would have passed.
If you studying hard, you pass.
questions.answer: If you study hard, you will pass the exam.

questions.question: Choose the correct form: 'If he _____ enough money, he will buy a new car.'
Complete the sentence: 'If you don't hurry, you _____ the bus.'
Which is a correct first conditional sentence?
options: If it rains, we stay inside.
If it raining, we will stay inside.
If it rain, we will stay inside.
If it rains, we will stay inside.
questions.answer: If it rains, we will stay inside.

questions.question: Choose the correct option: 'If my team _____ hard, they will win the tournament.'
Which word correctly completes the sentence: 'If you _____ attention, you will understand the lesson.'
What tense do we use in the 'if' clause of the first conditional?
What tense do we use in the result clause of the first conditional?
Choose the sentence that is NOT a first conditional sentence.
options: If you heat ice, it melts.
If you leave now, you will catch the train.
If it rains, we will cancel the picnic.
If he studies, he will pass the test.
questions.answer: If you heat ice, it melts.

questions.question: Choose the correct option: 'If she _____ the invitation, she will come to the party.'
Which is the correct first conditional sentence?
options: If they will work harder, they succeed.
If they work harder, they will succeed.
If they working harder, they will succeed.
If they worked harder, they would succeed.
questions.answer: If they work harder, they will succeed.
